result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale D. Drinkwater was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dale D. Drinkwater is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dale D. Drinkwater was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties concur on not having a PSI prepared.  Court advises DE right to PSI and DE waives and understands not to have PSI.  Court orders seal image and Clerk not to scan image.  State gives recommendation and history of DE. State requests Court orders return/destruction no later than 5 business days past the deadline of filing an appeal. Atty. Raabe makes statement, sites case law on child pornography and history.  Court imposes sentence.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe states matter is resolved and provides plea questionaire to the Court.  State states agreement.  Atty Raabe and DE agrees w/recs as stated.  Atty Raabe enters NC plea to Count 9.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea.  DE advised re: felony firearms warnings/voting rights.  Atty Raabe believes the Court needs to review the image itself prior to the finding.  Court will do so.  State shows image to the Court on her laptop.  Court reviews the image.  State notes they have complied w/victim's rights.  Court notes he has reviewed digital copy of the image described in Count 9 of the second amended information, finds factual basis for the plea, accepts it and finds DE guilty.  Parties in agreement to set sentencing for a later date.  Atty Raabe requests 3 weeks/needs time to review an old PSI in 07CF1.  Court sets out for sentencing.  Bond continued.

RECOMMENDATIONS:
Ct 9:  NC
7 1/2 years prison (3 years Initial Confinement and 4 1/2 years Extended Supervision) concurrent
Conditions of extended supervision:
$518.00 costs/surcharges
$500.00 image surcharge
DNA sample to be provided
Any counseling/treatment per agent

All other counts are dismissed (1-8, 10-14)  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 27, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes motions filed and letter rec'd on 10/14 from Atty Hoffman.  Atty Raabe states he never received this letter.  Court goes off the record so Atty Raabe can review the letter.  Back on the record, Court questions whether A.F. will be testifying as she is named in several motions.  Atty Raabe withdraws motions 1 through 4, 11, 14 through 16.  Atty Raabe states how he's going to handle the testimony now through cross-exam rather than calling his own witnesses.  State objects to learned treatises being used as Atty Raabe intends and explains why.  Court responds re: what was discussed at prior motion hearing.  Atty Raabe responds.  Court grants defense motion 12 w/understanding that he will not allow jury to pour over these documents to determine what they mean.  DE motion paragraph 5 and 6 covered by a State's motion.  Court addresses DE motion 8.  State responds.  Atty Raabe responds.  State to provide any "screen shots" to Atty Raabe prior to trial so they may be redacted if necessary.  Court will grant motion as to any searches that may prejudice the jury in re: to material that was searched that may reflect stalking behavior.  Court addresses images not turned over.  Atty Raabe requests State not be allowed to display any images not charged in this matter.  State responds/they intend to reference other images but unsure if they will use them at this point.  Parties argue.  Court instructs if a document/photo is legal for the normal man to possess then copies would need to be provided to Atty Raabe.  Atty Raabe asks re: providing copies of such documents to the DE.  Court will not direct parties in that respect as that is up to the DE to know what the DE can and cannot have in his possession.  Court addresses DE motion 13.  State believes thats already been addressed.  Atty Raabe responds.  Court grants 13.  That is the end of the DE motions except for companion motions to the State's motion.  Atty Raabe notes #7 - requests it be admitted as admissible hearsay.  Court questions nec-mec report.  State responds re: identification.  Atty Raabe responds.  Parties discuss.  Court doesn't think he'll be able to decide this today on the fly.  Court will rule on this the morning on trial.  Atty Raabe to make decision and provide that to the State by Monday.  Court addresses expert testimony.  Atty Raabe no longer intends on calling any experts to that motion would be moot.  State is in agreement re: expert being able to date photos.  Documents to be turned over by noon or Dr. Hendricks would not be allowed to testify per agreement.  Parties discuss rebuttal expert.  Any expert name to be provided to State by Monday.  Atty Raabe to address expert re: her age analysis.  Parties discuss Atty Raabe showing a passport to the expert.  State objects.  Parties argue.  Court questions which of the original 17 have been dismissed.  Atty Raabe is intending to question witness on #10, 11 and 12, which are the ones that have been dismissed from the original 17.  State notes #15 is also not charged.  Parties argue.  Court will not rule as he will have to see how that plays out at trial.  May need sidebar or excuse jury if necessary.  Atty Raabe states he wants to be allowed to question officer as to why some photos were originally charged and are no longer being charged.  State objects/trial w/in a trial.  Court advises Atty Raabe what he will not allow during closing arguments.  Atty Raabe responds.  Court affirms his prior statement.  Court address website searches done previously.  Atty Raabe doesn't object as those charges have now been dismissed.  State still wants the motion granted.  Court holds matter open in case it comes up.  Other acts evidence addressed in letter dated 10/14/2016.  State moves to admit conviction, pre-teen model search and presence of same images.  Atty Raabe notes discovery he just received today from the DA's office.  Has concern re: disc he just received today as to the search.  Computer from Col Co case has never been turned over to him so that is a discovery issue.  Court notes these offenses allow the greater latitude rule to apply.  Court notes he will not allow any videos involving children performing sexual acts.  Court addresses the issue of DE being on supervision and how the search happened due to his condition of not to have a computer.  Court grants the State's motion but in the limited fashion he's described as to images/search terms described in 10/14/16 correspondence from Atty Hoffman.  State makes argument as to erotica on this case re: the uncharged images.  Court questions.  Atty Raabe responds.  State responds.  Break at 11:04 a.m.  Back on the record at 11:15 a.m.  Court notes for purposes of the record re: other acts analysis and what he was thinking.  State is done re: child erotica.  Court addresses further the images of lewd display.  Court finds State has met first two prongs of the Sullivan analysis.  Court will allow certain child erotica images.  State believes anything they would introduce would fall into the child erotica category.  Court again advises State to provide those to Atty Raabe.  State notes discovery is accessible to Atty Raabe just like it is for anyone else.  Court again reviews DE motions.  Number 5 - Columbia Co conviction will be allowed.  State notes there would be 13 prior convictions if the DE chooses to testify.  Atty Raabe is unsure of correct number as of today.  States there is a chance the DE will testify.  Court orders State to provide Atty Raabe by noon on Monday the list of prior convictions and then Atty Raabe can notify the Court if there is a problem w/that.  No other convictions other than Columbia Co will be testified to.  DE motion 6 is denied.  DE motion 10 is granted w/the proviso that the State may introduce images of uncharged images per his prior ruling.  Court believes all motions have been heard now at this time.  Court notes on 10/27/2016 he has a day set aside for a contested divorce, suggests they meet again at 3:30 on 10/27/16 for any unresolved issues.  Proposed jury instructions to be filed by 10/27/2016 also.  Atty Raabe makes statement re: subpeonas.  State was planning on using individual pages and then publishing them to the jury.  Atty Raabe would agree w/that process.  Atty Raabe states he'll need the "elmo".  Court requests no charged images to be put on the screen.  Atty Raabe addresses discovery just rec'd re: statement DE made.  State doesn't intend to use written statements but would use statement made to agent.  Atty Raabe is in agreement.  Anything further to be filed by Monday.  Court is in recess.
Motion hearing on October 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on October 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion seeking access of discovery materials.  State responds.  No response on file.  Court has reviewed motion, responds and grants motion of defense.  Further scheduling discussed.  Court intends to stay on track for trial date.  Status conference, off the record, to be held.  Defendant will not be present.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.
to allow the DE access to discovery materials
Motion hearing on August 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.   Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time to investigate the 2 new counts on the information.  Parties discussed it.  Atty. Raabe is still looking for more specifics on those 2 new charges.  Drafted a motion to view images for the near future.  State wishes Court to set for a motion in the near future.  Court orders motion to be filed by 7/27/16.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin along w/intern Cody McConnell.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State notes motion for 2nd amended information along w/previous motions to be addressed today.  Atty Raabe notes he received the 2nd amended information and doesn't object.  State makes clarification re: attachments to amended information.  Court grants filing of 2nd amended information along w/two additional images.  Atty Raabe acknowledges rec. amended information.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Raabe stands mute to all counts.  Court enters Not Guilty pleas - Set for Trial.  Court then addresses the motions filed.  Court questions State re: clarification as to the images as to possible reservation of the ruling pending findings.  State responds.  Atty Raabe responds.  Court requests clarification.  Parties are in agreement that photos to be used to be decided by 9/30/2016.  Court then addresses DE's supervisory status.  Court advises he can see some confusion as to the jury wondering why DE's computer was searched.  Parties to let the Court know by 7/15/2016 the supervisory status of DE.  Court addresses prior conviction in Columbia Co and what the State wants to use.  State explains what they are trying to accomplish.  Parties discuss other acts evidence, etc. in regard to Columbia Co case as well.  Parties respond to questions by Court.  State addresses how to present this to the jury w/o actual images.  Court addresses three prong test in Sullivan.  Court explains his decison on the motions.  Court questions whether the parties need another date set at this time.  Parties agree it's not necessary now but might need one later.  Court is concerned that there is nothing set on the record at this time prior to trial.  Parties discuss matter off the record.  Back on the record, the Court has set a status conference.  DE wishes to be present at the STC so matter will be on the record.  Court notes decision made in re: to this motion.  Bond continued.
to expand timelimits for filing a response brief

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer David Frie appears.  Motion to modify bond & discovery.  Court will take up the discovery motion first.  Atty. Raabe states that the State is withholding discovery, has images and has not given copies to defense.  State makes statement - DE has access don't have to give copies.  Atty. Raabe states privilege under 901.05, court has authority.  Court denies motion for discovery and inspection.  Motion to modify bond - Atty. Raabe states 5 of the images are adults, State doesn't have a case on 8 of 17 images.  DE would like an opportunity to show.  State makes argument.  Atty. Raabe makes argument.  Court denies motion to modify bond.
Motion hearing on April 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on October 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on June 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not prepared for trial next week.  Atty. Raabe states lots of records to get yet.  Move trial date out. State has no objection.  3 days for trial still.  Court takes trial off for next week.  Reset to Oct. 31st.  Motion on if ADA Hoffman is going to testify or not - Atty. Raabe makes argument.  Court denies motion satisfied going thru other witnesses.  Motion to preclude ADA Hoffman as witness granted.  Motion to dismiss Ct. 8 - granted.  3/10/16 Motion to sourcing the images, motion to dismiss - Atty. Raabe states models are adults need to possess the images to determine.  Not able to do investigation at DOJ w/o possiblity of being charged.  Court inquires if law enforcement can do those things w/o being prosecuted at looking at images.  Court gives deadline to Atty. Raabe for a proposal of what investigation needs to be done at DOJ to see if they can do it or not.  Motion on Hendricks report - State has received nothing on expert. Court not to act on defense list at this time until closer to trial now.  Hold off on ruling related to the internet search evidence & passport photos.  Motion on admissibility of evidence - Court rules filing any motions by Sept. 30th to identify on evidence introduced.  Same deadline for motions #1, #2, #4 images from magazines, etc.  Motion #7 - Atty. Raabe makes argument.  Atty. Hoffman makes argument there was hits Meckmeck.  Atty. Raabe sites Statute 908.03(24) applies.  Court sites 908.03(6) - granted providing witness testifies to meckmeck.  Court not address #9 witness Murphy to answer yes or no.  Motion #11, #12 - Atty. Raabe going to use articles powerpoint.  Atty. Hoffman argues.  Deadline for July 29th.  Present to jury live on sites.  Court wants by Sept. 30th deadline.  State's motion in limine.  Defense wants time to respond, one month in writing.  Court gives Defense to May 6th, State's reply by June 3rd.  State has to indicate what uncharged images to bring in and look at.  Atty. Raabe brings up motions #12 & #13 go with #11.  State argues.  State to consult with det. Murphy on articles.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State's response to Defendant's motions in limine
Defendant's response to State's motion in limine
State's motion to admit evidence of DE's prior conviction
State's motion to preclude defendant from calling Linda Hoffman as a witness
State's motion for disclosure of defense expert report
State's motion requesting the court to rule pretrial on admissibility of evidence

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Premarked exhibits 1-18.  Court officer Cynthia Murphy.  Today handle pending motions.  Court wants to set deadlines for discovery prior to trial.  Atty. Raabe states depending on what happens today may need another month.  State needs time to respond/suppress.  Court sets a deadline of March 18 of addt'l testimony, March 25 for further work and April 1st for response.  Defense motion on protective order.  State states need to take up Dr. Knox and pictures and the open records request by defense.  Dr. Knox would like those pictures back.  Atty. Raabe would like to take up the daubert first.  Atty. Raabe explains to have a protective order for reverse image search.  State objects, trying to do illegal searches.  Violation of the Adam Walsh Act and would cause pictures more available to the public.  Atty. Raabe states not going to do that on reverse search.  Atty. Raabe calls Joseph Hendricks,digital forensic expert, S&T.  Marked exh. 19.  Atty. Hoffman cross exam.  Atty. Raabe redirect.  Atty. Hoffman recross.  Court direct of witness. Court excuse witness.  State calls Cindy Murphy, detective, S&T.  Recess.  Back on record - discuss personal photos of Dr. Knox.  Atty. Raabe makes argument and will not release to anyone.  State states she doesn't want anyone to have them, they are personal, has stalker and really have no bearing on this case.  Court not going to order defense to turn over today.  Court orders State to depicit which images, those images would be atty's eyes only.  State continue direct of witness.  Recess.  Proceed 1:04. Atty. Raabe cross exam. Recess.  Court addresses the parties on the draft of protective order.  Atty. Hoffman direct of witness to speed things up.  Atty. Raabe cross exam.  State redirect.  Court satisfied with witness disorientation.  Atty. Raabe continue redirect.  Atty. Raabe states witness' thesis is not adequate. Court will let proceed.  Witness has to back in Madison, Atty. Raabe has to have more time to exam this witness and has more articles/studies.  State objects to relevance and study of adults.  Atty. Raabe states Counts 10, 12, & 15 are not children, they are adults and makes argument.  Court lets witness come off the stand.  Atty. Hoffman makes argument of the methology of this witness.  Atty. Raabe makes argument methology not scientific and makes 7 points.  Court is satisfied that detective Murphy has expertise in this area.  Court finds that detective Murphy is an expert and may testify.  Court will not authorize an activity that will result in uploading these images to a server.  If Court is wrong or has authority on having 3rd party to upload these images then defense can let court know that.  Atty. Raabe makes comment.  Court tells the parties to talk amongst each other to see if this can happen.  State makes comment on protective images.  Court directs State to submit a written description of the images.
for protective order allowing the investigation of alleged child pornography at the DOJ

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes motion hearing today on DE's companion motions re: Franks hearing as to the complaint and motion to withdraw of preliminary hearing.  Court notes he reviewed written reply by State and the State is ready to proceed.  Atty Raabe states he has replies but is curious how the Court wishes to proceed today.  Court addresses issue w/the complaint first.  Atty Raabe explains his intention in the motion re: "child porn".  State responds.  Court asks questions and parties discuss.  Court denies motion re: Franks motion.  Atty Raabe asks for clarification as to what the Court believes adds up to probable cause.  Court responds.  Court then questions Atty Raabe as to whether he's spoken to Atty Benavides re: the preliminary hearing being waived.  Atty Raabe states he hasn't spoken to Atty Benavides.  Court questions Atty Raabe and he responds.  Atty Raabe wishes for the Court to review the images before making a determination.  Court questions Atty Raabe and he responds.  State responds.  Court denies the motion re: the withdrawal of the prelim waiver.  State questions DE re: a possible witness.  Atty Raabe states he will not be calling that witness.  Parties discuss computer experts and other witnesses being called.  Court wants the issue teed up sooner rather than later as to experts on reverse image searches.
State's response to DE's motion for Franks Mann hearing, Motion to Dismiss & Motion to Rescind Waiver
from Atty. Raabe - preliminary case report of digital forensics

Motion hearing at 02-24-2016 09:00 am.
Motion hearing at 04-04-2016 10:00 am.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Raabe advises the speedy trial is withdrawn.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Attorney Raabe agrees defendant understands the withdrawal of the speedy trial demand.  State gives status of witness availability.  Court sets three day trial starting April 12, 2016.  Daubert hearing addressed and upcoming motion hearings scheduled.  Off the record to discuss possible motions.  Attorney Raabe to file written Daubert motion.  Any Daubert motions to be filed by Feb. 11, 2016.  Any written responses, if desired, filed by Feb 18, 2016.  Motion in Limine to be filed by March 24, 2016.  Any responses by March 31, 2016.  Jury instructions filed by April 8, 2016. Jury trial scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Raabe filed motions to be heard at this time.  State notes she was just notified of these motions late on 1/19/16 and agreed to having this set w/o seeing those motions but now after seeing the length of the motions she is not prepared and is requesting a reset.  Court notes trial is set for next month and the motion in limine hearing is set for 2/10 and 2/18 prior to trial.  Court states what he believes the issues are at this time.  Atty Raabe agrees w/summation made by the Court but states he feels pictures should be attached to the complaint.  State notes that would be a law violation and the Court notes there is rarely an attachment to a criminal complaint.  Parties discuss the motions.  Atty Raabe requests a day to think about how he would like to proceed.  State states concern re: witness list.  Atty Raabe responds re: witness.  Court notes daubert hearing could be handled on 2/10/16.  State says their necessary witness is available on that date.  Atty Raabe states he will provide the possible 2 or 3 names he would have for expert witnesses before the end of the day tomorrow.  State notes they will need the reports well in advance as well.  Court states he won't schedule anything further on the motion at this time.  Court addresses the motion to modify bond.  State is objecting to the motion to modify being held today due to lack of notice.  Court notes he would not be inclined at this time to modify bond based on that fact that the case may be dismissed prior to trial.  State responds against bond modification.  Atty Raabe responds/argues for lesser cash bond.  Court denies motion for bond modification at this time.  Court is adjourned.
to hold a Franks hearing, motion to dismiss & to rescind waiver of the preliminary hearing

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Raabe gives status.  State clarifies re: experts being called.  Possibly not need for Daubert hearing today.  Defendant to file motion regarding viewing evidence.  Court addresses accurancy of scheduling conference.  Both parties agree a Daubert hearing should be scheduled.  Attorney Raabe request bond modification hearing.  Court will await any scheduling upon motions being filed.  State to respond to any motions filed by Attorney Raabe within 5 business days.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's motion to set cash bond.  State calls Kathy Laatsch, Supervisor for DOC, Sauk County.  Gives status of supervision.  Attorney Raabe has no comment.  State gives recommendation.   Attorney Raabe gives argument and recommendation.  Request signature bond.  Court sets $10,000.00 CASH bond.   Matter set for status.  No defendant needed to be present for status.  Status hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:45 am.  Attorney Raabe request speedy trial demand.  Request 2-3 day trial dates.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE in custody, need OTP from Redgranite.  Atty. just recv'd case from Benavides.  Remove from trial and reset FPT and JT.  Bond continues.
Atty Benavides acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and pleads NG.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and NG pleas entered.  Bond continued.

Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Defendant Dale D. Drinkwater in custody.  Sue Mueller and intern, Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Time limits waived. State request PTC/RD.  State request cash.  $10,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.
